snippet: A well-regarded program does not meet new federal nutrition standards, the New York City Department of Education said.
abstract: New York City Education Dept ends a well-regarded program, organized by nonprofit group Wellness in the Schools, that recruited professional chefs to help the department provide fresher, healthier food to students; dept officials say program's approach does not comply with federal nutritional standards for school meals under the Child Nutrition Reauthorization Act, which provides additional subsidy for schools that comply.
lead_paragraph: A well-regarded program does not meet new federal nutrition standards, the New York City Department of Education said.

headline.seo: New York City Ends School Lunch Program That Used Professional Chefs
headline.main: City Ends School Lunch Program That Used Professional Chefs
headline.print_headline: City Ends School Lunch Program That Used Professional Chefs
